page.title: 02Churches and Religion
page.content: If going to church is considered to be a middle class activity then this could explain the poor attendance at the areas three churches, being essentially working class. Iwade, Bobbing and Milton are ecclesiastical parishes, but only Milton has its own vicar, who has maintained isolation by refusing to be combined with another parish. Meanwhile, the satisfactory grouping of Iwade, Newington and Bobbing was ended three years ago in 1982 resulting in the pastoral care of Iwade becoming the charge of a vicar of a Sittinbourne parish, with Bobbing being in a similar position. The three churches are magnificient buildings of the 11th and 13th centuries, needing a lot of maintenance which is a heavy burden on the small congregations. The population would claim to be mainly Church of England.
